content.raw:
@kev-the-dev , just curious about this, never tried a laser in the water. In the real world, are the laser beams detecting the surface of the land under the water or is the water attenuating the beams and you actually don’t see anything unless there’s a real obstacle or you’re close to the ground.

We think there’s a way to avoid the GPU laser colliding with the water. I’ll do it in a separate pull request in any case.
content.html:
@kev-the-dev , just curious about this, never tried a laser in the water. In the real world, are the laser beams detecting the surface of the land under the water or is the water attenuating the beams and you actually don’t see anything unless there’s a real obstacle or you’re close to the ground.

We think there’s a way to avoid the GPU laser colliding with the water. I’ll do it in a separate pull request in any case.
